results.title: Correlation
results.creator_credit: Jill Singer, American Statistical Association, Chedd-Angier Productions and COMAP
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Against all odds: inside statistics”.
This program looks at the strength and direction of the relationship between two variables, by interpreting correlations, deriving the correlation co-efficient, and correlation and regression. Examples used are the relationship between twins’ personality and whether they were raised together or apart, and the relationship between baseball home runs and players’ salaries.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jill Singer, American Statistical Association, Chedd-Angier Productions and COMAP

results.title: Singlehanders
results.creator_credit: Shelagh Mackenzie, Kent Nason and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Alone on the open sea! Two Canadians, Bob Lush and Mike Birch, took cameras aboard their yachts during the 1980 Observer Singlehanded Transatlantic Race. The result is more than a record of this prestigious international sailing event. The sport of ocean racing becomes the starting point for an epic of challenge and determination.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shelagh Mackenzie, Kent Nason and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Silent passages
results.brief_description:
Silent Passages is based around photographs taken of the World War 2 tunnels under the Darwin and inspired by the kind of fantasy storytelling used in games such as Riven and Myst. In the words of the artist “We find a man alone at the entrance to a tunnel. He enters. The labyrinth before him, a reminder of a past long gone. Eerie sounds are triggered as he passes from chamber to chamber and nothing appears as it seems. His story is hidden beneath a mask of time and decay.
Silent Passages is a legend within a story. Two parallel journeys fused by a lover, and torn apart by the betrayal of war.” Soundtrack is “Music for Guitar and Shakuhachi” by Andrew MacGregor and Marion Schaap.

results.title: Experimental design
results.creator_credit: Jill Singer, Peggy Girshman, Chedd-Angier Productions and COMAP
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Against all odds: inside statistics”.
Theresa M. Amabile introduces this first program on the design and conduct of experiments. She discusses the distinction between observational studies and experiments, the concept of control groups to reduce the risk of confounding results and randomized comparative experiments. Examples used are studies of lobsters and how they communicate, the use of aspirin in reducing the incidence of heart attacks and how the police should deal with cases of domestic violence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jill Singer, Peggy Girshman, Chedd-Angier Productions and COMAP

results.title: Silks and Saddles (1921)
results.brief_description: This film is firmly within the genre of racecourse melodrama. On the prosperous stud farm of Kangarooie, the squatter’s daughter, Bobbie, is torn between rival suitors whilst her weak-willed brother is embroiled with racketeers and a high society vamp. After much complex criminal activity in the stables before the big race the heroine herself rides her horse to victory.
results.description: This film is firmly within the genre of racecourse melodrama. On the prosperous stud farm of Kangarooie, the squatter’s daughter, Bobbie, is torn between rival suitors whilst her weak-willed brother is embroiled with racketeers and a high society vamp. After much complex criminal activity in the stables before the big race the heroine herself rides her horse to victory.

After much complex criminal activity in the stables before the big race the heroine herself rides her horse to victory.

results.title: Comparing two means
results.creator_credit: David Huntley, Stephen Braun, Chedd-Angier Productions, American Statistical Association and COMAP
results.brief_description:
Episode number 22 of Series “Against all odds: inside statistics”.
Teresa M. Amabile looks at how to analyse two-sample problems, using a t procedure, to calculate the confidence interval for the difference between two means and a significance test to see whether two populations have two different means. Examples used are a comparison of two job training schemes for welfare recipients, testing the properties of a new foam product against the former one, and the efficacy of coaching for aptitude tests.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Huntley, Stephen Braun, Chedd-Angier Productions, American Statistical Association and COMAP

results.title: Since I Left You – The Avalanches
results.brief_description: Directed by Rob Leggatt and Leigh Marling, The Avalanches’ ‘Since I Left You’ manages to combine familiar pop culture touchstones like Flashdance (1983) with the utterly surreal as two miners burrow through a black and white world into full colour.

constellations_primary.name: Remix and resistance (Since I left you)
constellations_primary.description: The Avalanches' music videos are part of a long artistic tradition of reappropriation as a means of reframing perception.

results.description: It seems fitting that for a band with such an unusual musical reputation like The Avalanches, the accompanying visuals to ‘Since I Left You’ would be so unique as well. Directed by Rob Leggatt and Leigh Marling from the Blue Source art collective, it manages to combine familiar pop culture touchstones like Flashdance (1983) with the utterly surreal as two miners burrow through a black and white world into full colour.
description_for_label: It seems fitting that for a band with such an unusual musical reputation like The Avalanches, the accompanying visuals to ‘Since I Left You’ would be so unique as well. Directed by Rob Leggatt and Leigh Marling from the Blue Source art collective, it manages to combine familiar pop culture touchstones like Flashdance (1983) with the utterly surreal as two miners burrow through a black and white world into full colour.

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Australia → MA-04. Music Video

results.title: Silent Number
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Jamie Blanks and Hugh Burton
results.brief_description: Babysitter Nicole is subjected to a horrific night of phone calls from a guy called Matt, claiming to be beaten by his father and imprisoned in a cold place. When a bloodied man comes to the door claiming that he and his wife have been in an accident, she decides it is time to call the police. Cast includes Bronwyn Jones and John Brumpton.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Jamie Blanks and Hugh Burton

results.title: An Interview with Joyce Bryan
results.brief_description: Joyce Bryan was a witness to the return of the Prisoners of War from Japan. She provides an powerful and detailed rendering of the emotionally charged return and the struggles of the men to fit back into society.
results.description: Joyce Bryan was a witness to the return of the Prisoners of War from Japan. She provides an powerful and detailed rendering of the emotionally charged return and the struggles of the men to fit back into society.
